results.definition: to make a rush at or sudden attack upon, as in battle
examples: he saw Jess charging at him with a pitchfork

results.definition: blame for, make a claim of wrongdoing or misbehavior against
examples: he charged the director with indifference

results.definition: demand payment
examples: Will I get charged for this service?
We were billed for 4 nights in the hotel, although we stayed only 3 nights

results.definition: move quickly and violently
examples: The car tore down the street
He came charging into my office

results.definition: assign a duty, responsibility or obligation to
examples: He was appointed deputy manager
She was charged with supervising the creation of a concordance

results.definition: file a formal charge against
examples: The suspect was charged with murdering his wife

results.definition: make an accusatory claim
examples: The defense attorney charged that the jurors were biased

results.definition: fill or load to capacity
examples: charge the wagon with hay

results.definition: enter a certain amount as a charge
examples: he charged me $15

results.definition: cause to be admitted; of persons to an institution
examples: After the second episode, she had to be committed
he was committed to prison

results.definition: give over to another for care or safekeeping
examples: consign your baggage

results.definition: pay with a credit card; pay with plastic money; postpone payment by recording a purchase as a debt
examples: Will you pay cash or charge the purchase?

results.definition: lie down on command, of hunting dogs
cause to be agitated, excited, or roused
examples: The speaker charged up the crowd with his inflammatory remarks

results.definition: place a heraldic bearing on
examples: charge all weapons, shields, and banners

results.definition: provide (a device) with something necessary
examples: He loaded his gun carefully
load the camera

results.definition: direct into a position for use
examples: point a gun
He charged his weapon at me

results.definition: impose a task upon, assign a responsibility to
examples: He charged her with cleaning up all the files over the weekend

results.definition: instruct (a jury) about the law, its application, and the weighing of evidence
instruct or command with authority
examples: The teacher charged the children to memorize the poem

results.definition: attribute responsibility to
examples: We blamed the accident on her
The tragedy was charged to her inexperience

results.definition: set or ask for a certain price
examples: How much do you charge for lunch?
This fellow charges $100 for a massage

results.definition: cause formation of a net electrical charge in or on
examples: charge a conductor

results.definition: energize a battery by passing a current through it in the direction opposite to discharge
examples: I need to charge my car battery

results.definition: saturate
examples: The room was charged with tension and anxiety
